/work/doc/pages/MessageSequenceNumbers.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 \defgroup message-sequence-numbers Message Sequence Numbers
2 \ingroup fixp-protocol-session
3 
4 \details
5 
6 \section message-sequencing Message Sequencing
7 
8 Each \ref fixp-protocol-session establishes *independent* incoming and outgoing message sequence numbers series.
9 
10 Sequence numbers are initialized at the start of an FIXP session, starting at `1`
11 and incremented by each application-level message through the session.
12 
13 A single FIXP session with the same \ref session-version-identification can exist across multiple sequential physical
14 connections. The client can connect and disconnect multiple times while maintaining the same FIXP session.
15 
16 Once the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::disconnect method is called,
17 the physical connection is terminated, but the logical session does not end its lifetime.
18 It is possible to continue the session later, using the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::connect method again.
19 
20 \image html fixp-session-sequence-numbers.gif
21 
22 \see \ref restoring-session-state
23 \see \ref scheduler
24 
25 \section manipulating-message-sequence-numbers Manipulating Message Sequence Numbers
26 
27 To get the expected sequence number of the next incoming message, use the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::inSeqNum method.
28 
29 To get the sequence number of the next outgoing message, use the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::outSeqNum method.
30 
31 \subsection resetting-sequence-numbers Resetting Sequence Numbers
32 
33 Resetting inbound and outbound message sequence numbers back to `1`, for whatever reason,
34 constitutes the beginning of a new logical FIXP session that should have a new SessionVerID. The OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::reset
35 method must be used to back up previous log files, generate a new SessionVerID, and reset sequence numbers to `1`.
36 
37 \note OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::inSeqNum and OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::outSeqNum
38 methods can be used to set expected sequence numbers manually before an FIXP session is
39 established. However, it is NOT recommended to use these methods to reset the message
40 sequence numbers back to `1` to start a new logical FIXP session. Instead, use the OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::reset
41 method.
